meanings.definition: To insert or receive into a sheath or envelope.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was invaginating itself into the cocoon.
meanings.sent2: She carefully invaginated the letter into the envelope.
meanings.sent3: The magician invaginated the scarf into his sleeve and made it disappear!
meanings.sent4: The detective invaginated the key evidence into the case file.
meanings.sent5: The chef invaginated the filling into the pastry with precision.

meanings.sent1: The flower petals invaginated as the bud bloomed.
meanings.sent2: He invaginated the map to fit it into his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella invaginated quickly when the wind picked up.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts invaginated, focusing on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The origami artist invaginated the paper to create a beautiful swan.
